description: This course provides an introduction to general semanticsâ€”the study of how we transform our life experiences into language and thought. Students will learn how their language habits and behaviors, as well as how they think about and share experiences, are what make them uniquely human. In other words, students will discover the critical, but sometimes subtle distinctions between what happens in their lives and how they talk about what happens.
title: General Semantics: An Approach to Effective Language Behavior
instructors: Steve Stockdale, Greg Thompson, Ph.D. and Mary Lahman, Ph.D.
